title: Easy Ways to Be a Nicer Person at Work and Improve Your Relationships

steps.title: Try to greet them as you walk in the door every day.
steps.content: Try to greet them as you walk in the door every day. It might sound like a small thing, but a nice greeting from you could seriously lift up someone’s mood if they’re having a bad day. [1] X Research source Saying good morning to your coworkers also makes you feel more approachable. If you can be casual at the beginning of the day, your coworkers are more likely to chat with you throughout the work day.

steps.title: Talk about something other than work on your breaks.
steps.content: Talk about something other than work on your breaks. Chat about your children, what you like to do on the weekends, and what you all do for fun. [2] X Research source Getting to know your coworkers will foster a relationship and develop a bond between you all. Make sure you tell your coworkers about yourself too! Talk about the fun stuff you did last weekend or what your plans are for the evening.

steps.title: Keep a positive attitude while you’re at work, even when it’s tough.
steps.content: Keep a positive attitude while you’re at work, even when it’s tough. If you can find the silver lining even in a bad situation, people will start to see you as a nice, kind person to rely on. [3] X Research source For example, if you and your team miss a deadline, you could say, “Well, at least we know how much time we need to carve out for the next project.” Or, if you have to work late, you could say, “Thank goodness we’re getting paid overtime for this.”

steps.title: Nod along and ask questions when you talk to your coworkers.
steps.content: Nod along and ask questions when you talk to your coworkers. Show that you’re really listening to what they have to say instead of dismissing them right away. [4] X Research source For example, if your coworker is telling you something about your next assignment, you could say, “So what you need is a double page document by the end of the day?” If you’re just chatting about your personal life with your coworkers, you could ask, “So what happened with your kid’s recital last night?”

steps.title: Get organized, meet your deadlines, and collaborate with your coworkers.
steps.content: Get organized, meet your deadlines, and collaborate with your coworkers. The better you can do your job, the more people will see you as a reliable person. [5] X Research source While doing your job well on its own won’t make people view you as “nice” necessarily, if you couple it with a few other methods you can make sure people think that you’re a kind person. If you don’t do your job well, you can be the nicest person around, but people may still resent you.

steps.title: Remember that everyone works at a different pace and with a different style.
steps.content: Remember that everyone works at a different pace and with a different style. Instead of getting frustrated at your coworkers if they do something differently than you, try to respect their needs and let them work how they need to. [6] X Research source For example, you might be able to chat and listen to music while you work, but other people might need complete silence. Instead of getting offended that they don’t want to talk, let them do their work on their own.

steps.title: Offer your assistance if one of your coworkers is struggling.
steps.content: Offer your assistance if one of your coworkers is struggling. While you might not be able to do their work for them, you can offer to bring them new materials or go over their work, especially if you’re on a team together. [7] X Research source If you do something kind for one of your colleagues, they’ll probably return the favor later on.

steps.title: Recognize when you’ve messed up and tell everyone how you can do better.
steps.content: Recognize when you’ve messed up and tell everyone how you can do better. Don’t try to assign the blame to anyone else; instead, take accountability if you mess up. [8] X Research source For example, you could say, “I misplaced the report we needed and that meant we missed the deadline. I’m really sorry, and I’m going to work on my organizational skills for next time.”

steps.title: Just a quick “nice job!”
steps.content: Just a quick “nice job!” can really make someone feel good. Try to point out when one of your coworkers gets something done quickly, works extra hard, or goes above and beyond their job duties. [9] X Research source Positive reinforcement tends to make people work harder and with more enthusiasm. If you’re in charge of a team, try to encourage your employees to be more productive by rewarding them when they’ve done well.

steps.title: If there’s a coworker you have a problem with, confront them directly.
steps.content: If there’s a coworker you have a problem with, confront them directly. Don’t spend time being passive aggressive or talking about them with other people. Instead, sit down with them and talk through your issues together. [10] X Research source Gossiping about others is a surefire way to start work drama, which is never fun. If you’re having a big problem with someone that you can’t resolve on your own, consider taking it to your HR department for help. Try not to take workplace stress personally. Instead, take a step back and look at what's triggering those emotions so you can start to cope with them. [11] X Expert Source Arda Ozdemir, MA Career & Life Coach Expert Interview. 4 October 2019.

steps.title: Show a small gesture of kindness every other month or so.
steps.content: Show a small gesture of kindness every other month or so. Splurge on coffee in the morning, bring in donuts for everyone, or treat your coworkers to lunch. Chances are, they’ll even repay the favor! [12] X Research source These small niceties can really make people see you as a fun, kind person. Don’t break the bank—if you can’t afford to buy everyone food or drinks, don’t worry about it.
